info.game_comments: (Kermit the Frog: Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog here.  You know, finally, after 18 seasons, Jeopardy! is letting another species do a clue?  Hm!  'Bout time, don't you think?  Yeah, me too.)

(1, 1).clue: Known to his 19th century enemies as "Useless", reports had this man drunk and disorderly

(3, 1).clue: According to legend, this wizard is buried at the root of a thorn tree near the river Tweed in Scotland

(4, 1).clue: Now associated with Holland, this flower was introduced to western Europe from Turkey in the 16th century

(5, 1).clue: Your standard potato is 80 percent this common compound

(6, 1).clue: This person changes the reels in the back of the movie theater, hopefully in the right order

(1, 2).clue: Seen here, this 19th century man is wanted for making a 8,500-word inaugural speech in freezing weather

(2, 2).clue: "My Eardrums Are Being Stimulated By One Complex Orchestral Work"

(3, 2).clue: This student at Hogwarts has a lightning-bolt scar on his forehead

(4, 2).clue: The crescent & the star on Turkey's flag are 2 traditional symbols of this religion

(5, 2).clue: This traditional cured meat is often served with cabbage on St. Patrick's Day

(6, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew writing on a chalkboard.) The tilde goes over Ns in Spanish, but over vowels in this neighboring language

(1, 3).clue: This man pictured here is wanted by some for stealing the 1876 election

(2, 3).clue: "It's Impossible To Rush Strong Affection For Another"

(3, 3).clue: In July of 1973 this game show, my first in America, debuted on NBC

(4, 3).clue: In the 4th century, this present-day Turkish city was known as "New Rome"

(5, 3).clue: When shopping in Athens, you can snack on souvlaki, chunks of this meat, called arni, on a stick

(6, 3).clue: The name of this protective South American outerwear is from the Spanish for "faded"

(1, 4).clue: Some say this man also known as the "Beast of Buffalo" jaywalked on two non-consecutive occasions

(2, 4).clue: "What's The New Site Of The Emotional Connections We Share"

(3, 4).clue: Called the "Wizard of Westwood", this UCLA coach is in the Basketball Hall of Fame as both a coach & a player

(4, 4).clue: In 1853 the Turks declared war on this country, beginning the Crimean War

(5, 4).clue: A 23-inch by 14 1/2-inch one of these was produced in 1990 by a Pringle's plant in Tennessee

(6, 4).clue: It's an ornament or piece of jewelry that hangs from a necklace

(1, 5).clue: 5'4" and less than 100 pounds, this man is known as the "Sage of Montpelier" and "President Short Stuff"

(2, 5).clue: "At A Future Time, A Reunion For Us"

(4, 5).clue: In both 1967 & 1974, Turkey almost went to war with Greece over problems on this island

(5, 5).clue: At 19, this future potato breeder read Darwin's "Variation of Animals and Plants Under Domestication"

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew wearing a tallit.) Known in Hebrew as tallit, it's the morning religious garment I'm wearing

(1, 1).clue: Prussia's William I had plenty to reflect on when he was crowned German emperor in 1871 in this Versailles roo

(2, 1).clue: Known for his extreme patriotism, Sam, of "Muppet Show" fame, is one of these birds

(3, 1).clue: No roads lead into this U.S. state capital; it can only be reached by aircraft or boat

(4, 1).clue: The USA's largest artificial lake, Lake Mead is the reservoir behind this dam

(5, 1).clue: 1974: "The great fish moved silently through the night water, propelled by short sweeps of its crescent tail"

(6, 1).clue: My aunt likes to lunch on this fish

(1, 2).clue: Family that held a virtual monopoly on supplying the big guns to Prussia

(2, 2).clue: It takes the wizardry of Frank Oz to bring this dangerous drummer to life

(3, 2).clue: Gates opening into this city's "Old City" include Lion's Gate, Zion Gate & Herod's Gate

(4, 2).clue: In 1926 she became curator of ethnology at the American Museum of Natural History

(5, 2).clue: The 1860s: "My father's family name being Pirrip, & my Christian name Philip..."

(6, 2).clue: Mmm! It's one fish that melts in your mouth

(1, 3).clue: This Prussian statesman & prince was the one who shifted the war into Otto-matic

(5, 3).clue: 1996: "New Year's resolutions. I will not drink more than fourteen units of alcohol a week"

(6, 3).clue: You don't need a tutor to catch this fish
